title: "concat_all"
output: html_document
---

# 1. Read all

```{r read_all}
# part 1 is gold standard
part2 <- read.csv("20022019_Part2_answers.csv", sep=";") %>% 
  separate(AudioData, c("path", "AudioData"), sep=-14) %>% 
  select(c(UserID, AudioData, Answer))

part3 <- read.csv("20022019_Part3_answers.csv", sep=";") %>% 
  separate(AudioData, c("path", "AudioData"), sep=-14) %>% 
  select(c(UserID, AudioData, Answer))

part4 <- read.csv("20022019_Part4_answers.csv", sep=";") %>% 
  separate(AudioData, c("path", "AudioData"), sep=-14) %>%
  select(c(UserID, AudioData, Answer))

part5 <- read.csv("20022019_Part5_answers.csv", sep=";") %>% 
  separate(AudioData, c("path", "AudioData"), sep=-14) %>%
  select(c(UserID, AudioData, Answer))

part6 <- read.csv("./20190708-141738_the-maturity-of-baby-sounds-part-6_answers.csv", sep=';') %>% 
  select(c(User.ID, Media.File, Answer)) %>% 
  rename(UserID=User.ID, AudioData=Media.File)

part7 <- read.csv("./20190708-145538_the-maturity-of-baby-sounds-part-7_answers.csv", sep=';') %>%
  select(c(User.ID, Media.File, Answer)) %>% 
  rename(UserID=User.ID, AudioData=Media.File)

colnames(part2)
colnames(part3)
colnames(part4)
colnames(part5)
colnames(part6)
colnames(part7)

all_parts <- bind_rows(part2, part3, part4, part5, part6, part7)

```

# 2. Analyze all

```{r double_coders}
analysis <- all_parts %>% 
  group_by(UserID, AudioData) %>% 
  count() %>% 
  filter(n>1)

analysis %>% distinct(AudioData) %>% nrow()
analysis %>% distinct(UserID) %>% nrow()

```
